alert.note: Alert for Cheatham; Davidson; Dickson; Hickman; Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 3:57PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Davidson, southern Dickson, northwestern Williamson, southeastern Cheatham and northeastern Hickman Counties through 430 PM CDT... At 357 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Pegram to 6 miles west of Dickson. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Franklin, Dickson, Ashland City, Brentwood, Forest Hills, White Bluff, Belle Meade, Kingston Springs, Pegram, Burns, Bellevue, Fairview, Bon Aqua, Lyles and Natchez Trace At Highway 96. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
